XLzAcH75YYNTl7LW87CFfA.review_text: After 8 years in Europe, I love cafe life... and searched online to find something similiar here in SF.  Man- oh man... if you hate 420 this is NOT the place for you.  As I write, I am overwhelmed by the pot smoke waifting in from the group of Rastafarians in the patio.  Music is bad, and way too loud.  Its too bad because the dark wood floors, and lovely tin bar make the decor fabulous.  If you like 420, I suppose this is an ideal place.

Q5nabCnHITcdk4ojKST4Kg.review_text: This is one of the best places I have ever been for music.  I like the relaxed feel and that Conservatory students coming in and playing whatever they like at 8pm on Sunday nights.  My one wish is that it had more different types of beer.

SgiBkhXeqIKl1PlFpZOycQ.review_text: We headed here after we saw Sing-a-Long Sound of Music to grab some coffee and to debrief after our great time at the event.  The place was packed on a Sunday evening at 5.  There was a great jazz band playing, albeit a little loud.    They had these awesome ginger lattes that were SO good.  Not too strong, and really helped soothe our throats after our sing-a-long experience.    Diverse group of people, and very different coffee house/bar than what you would find in the South Bay.  I know, I'm sheltered, but I really enjoyed this place!

rZRCEAy-xv7TwDstUliTnA.review_text: Liquids - check Snacks - check Alcoholic liquids - check Lots of seating - check Outdoor seating - bonus check Cool waitstaff - check Wifi - check Warm Mission air - check  What's not to like! Bring your laptop, a book or just yourself and you can sip a latte, chug a beer and people watch all day long.

KKdBQXnUlVUZ0ZNTfMQoEA.review_text: If I were more of a hipster, or more into the Mission scene, I would easily give this place 4 stars. But I'm not so much into that, so I need to settle with a 3. The great thing about Revolution is that it probably reflects what this whole "Mission hipster" thing was SUPPOSED to be. A nice little communist theme, a cafe with tea, espresso, beer, wine, sangria, and mojitos, good conversation with typically-like-minded individuals, and some really, really, independent music (sometimes too independent).  They've got great beer (chimay, boont amber, etc. on tap), a limited wine selection, and supposedly great sangria. I even like their darn lemon-herb tea bags.  This place is in it's element on a weeknight, where the locals are out, having just a drink or two, talking, smoking, being their mission hipsters selves. Whenever I go, I almost believe I could be one too. It's romantic that way.

_I1mtDb9qkaDU3t0UPqtPw.review_text: You know, I've never had a bad time here, and I've had innumerable variety of experiences at this Mission institution. To whit: over the years, I've performed here, watched, danced and listened to all other sorts of music (jazz, funk, Classical Revolution, samba, and twang), hung out with my best friends, gone on blind dates, hung out with unrequited loves, been introduced to a new form of yoga, wrote, drew and sat at one of the sidewalk tables and simply dreamed. There's just a vibe here. It's never boring, there's drink to please the  2-year-old, the partier and the recovering alcoholic, a variety of menu items to satisfy most cravings,  smokers can do their thing outside, and the crowd is equally diverse as the musical line-up. Unsure about what to do in SF? Go to the Revolution. Something will be happening.

8QCdHp9s3PHhcfOLpYynhQ.review_text: This place has a very European feel.  The outside seating was nice and there was plenty to watch in the neighbor hood.  It was a good place to stop for a drink.

KPHWkOP6YEhQzZQtpZBljQ.review_text: the outdoor seating is key, giving this small cafe a euro flavor and integrating it with the neighborhood.  great place to work or chat in the afternoon; excellent bands at night.  the tables are lacquered with maps and the sweet potato pie is really good when in stock.  if you live in the area it's a no-brainer.

63SQPROZ48xwGUb2LloFQA.review_text: We ducked in Revolution Cafe for a drink before dinner at Lolo. I used to live around the corner when this place first opened, or at least the first business that used the space as a three walled cafe.  Not sure what it was about the place, but i didn't seem right too me. It would work better for me as a coffee only place or, if drinks are to be served, they allow people to smoke inside. The whole thing didn't add up for me.

yXnuorbaYG5N5SbERJ4m-Q.review_text: this is a GREAT place. open air, good drinks, and live music all the time. the only downside is that it's always crowded. getting a table outside can be challenging at times.

_dC3wEoq02Op4lCyzYXSZg.review_text: I wrote my doctoral dissertation in this place: Coffee in the mornings, beers during happy hour, nights of jazz, wine, interesting bands and piano debutants. The crowd is definitely eccentric, from the alcoholic aggressive lesbian who demands more than two beers by noon, to the club of retired cuban seniors who religiously meet there at 1pm. I was personally annoyed occasionally by the smoke of cigarettes and other stimulants that regularly get into the place, but overall this place made the year I lived in the Mission one of the best.

B7ecAeAIrXg7sgmabS38pg.review_text: So many times, I've walked by this place, rolled my eyes at the clusterf*ck, packy packed crowds and just kept walking. That was until yesterday, when we decided to pop in here for a beer.   I was surprised at how much I enjoyed the place. Yes, it was packed, but we pretty much grabbed the corner and were in our own little world. I can't imagine coming here and actually getting any work done as I am far too easily distracted, but looking around it seemed that people were laptoppin' it up and getting things done which was cool to see.  Not sure if I would rush back here or wait around for a seat, but if you hit it and there are seats, you'll probably have fun. I know I did, but that probably had more to do with the company :)

AkPkijB6Pv9YH1pDxeU98g.review_text: This place can get super packed on the weekends and at night, and I can see why. Friendly staff, great live music, and a nice selection at the bar.  I'd recommend staying away on hot evenings because it can get really stuffy.

z8VKUxiALPm0QwRKmSqtkg.review_text: Ok. Revolutionary - its not.  Nope, not even a little bit.  No gente, its pretty sans edge. . But although the joint is relatively angst free, it does have a unique mix of your generic mission hipsters, an older school of beatnick / yippie types pining for the day when there was real R in the air in San Francisco, and a random smattering Marina types who were told that this is the place where  Che would have a drink -- if he wasn't assassinated by the CIA in 1967.  Oh yeah, and a few earnest but clueless dudes trying to score chicks and impress anyone who will listen to they spouting on about  how THEY are struggling to  forment the great uprising of the proletariat.... ....in San Francisco  ....in a cafe called  uhm... ....Revolution Cafe.  Ugh. (eye rolling)     Makes for good entertainment..    The place has a great worn wood feel, good outside table placement, awesome melty cheese sandwiches, and very serious beer selection.   I'm kinda in like with this place.  :)

kcczx52Tejrnm3i3SbLFSA.review_text: Cool bar, rude staff, but artsy-just what I needed that day. Somewhat-informed political discussions going on at most tables. Other patrons spoke as if they knew about literature. Some knew. Some didn't. It was just what I wanted that day...   Until the FOOD POISONING!!! I was sick for two days. Don't go. I don't think the employees wash their hands.

5Z5KUZ15rwWCM0ItYh4mXw.review_text: Love this place.  Great music.  Cozy atmosphere.  They keep it simple.  No credit cards?  No problem.  The guy that served us even fit well with the place, let's just put it that way. :)  I particularly like how the doors open up so you have a nice view of the street.  helps with the stuffiness of the place, too.   Didn't love the wine I had, but everything else makes up for it.   I shall be back.

SvPqtK81VPYW7ft9_skJNQ.review_text: Love. This. Place. I love everything about it. It's hard to find somewhere that is just as good for a late night cup of coffee as it is for a drink. And the beer is cheap! Revolution usually has some eclectic 12-piece band crammed in there making a ton of noise, which makes the party spill out onto the street, but it also makes everyone get to know each other pretty quickly. I think I've only gone here one time without making some sort of new friend. The cafe closes kind of early for a bar, but that's ok because then you can go dance your butt off at the Make Out Room.

a3prHYECsHFpLTHqHI1WSQ.review_text: i just called them to ask about their booking proces and the man who answered the phone said "google us we're online" and i was getting ready to say im online right now and i dont see you website, but he hung up in my face.

_SVAW_bwFx3G2tDqmsmOBw.review_text: It is a revolution in a certain sense.  It reminds me of some So Cal coffee shops where you get coffee see some live music and maybe have some booze at night.  In some senses it's a welcome departure from the dive bars of the Mission or your typical new swank hipster laden SF coffeehouses.  Aside from that the appeal is kind of minor.  The beer is good (Maudite!) and well priced ($4.50) and the ambiance can be interesting however I think my problem is that this place caters to some just plain inept people.  Don't get me wrong, I usually don't like criticizing a place based on clientele but at a certain point I felt like I was in the twilight zone.  One guy sat in front of my chair, seemed confused that I might need to get by him and proceeded to elbow my table, thereby sloshing my beer about at least two times just to let me by.  He watched this whole thing happen and didn't apologize.  A friend of mine went to the restroom and another patron walked in and threw her stuff on my friends chair and then walked away.  I had to move her stuff and let her know someone was sitting here and had been so for awhile.  I'm not holding that as a major thing against this place, it's just it feels like if I don't want to smoke weed outside with the band of misfits who look like they've just rolled out of a dirt cheap hostel then my other option is to catch elbows from random douches who come here.  Unless you're here for live music, I'd rather do my drinking at a bar with more beer options and where people at least have a modicum of courtesy.

EX-GktlqwQ1ejQ2j1E7v7g.review_text: Too small and a bit dirty, but GREAT music and good ambiance.

n4IepFnHiVuvLcGc35zjtA.review_text: One afternoon at the Art Bar/Papa Toby's/Revolution Cafe I watched an older man in a cheap track suit buy a briefcase full of pot, he later tried to bum $3 off of me for a beer -- as if I hadn't just seen him exchange a ball gag sized roll of cash for approximately a pound of weed . . .

almoHUKeIZRjfM8LkwI0AA.review_text: We walked past this cafe randomly on a Thursday night and were pleasantly surprised to find a great live band. Yelp check in feature gave us a free coffee which was awesome. Reasonably priced and great selection of cold and warm beverages too. Highly recommend this place for a chilled night out with friends - and for music lovers

xRRDnb76DZmlFF1xNKt-yw.review_text: I used to really love this place. Lately it seems kind of dirty, loud, and too crowded. The staff often seem to be kind of distracted or out of it. And they don't have their ginger latte anymore. I still go here, hoping it will feel like it used to, but I usually leave feeling disappointed.

md6Fmsx5A3RvfAtVLqsTmw.review_text: great place to catch sun any time of the day. love the sidewalk seating. revolution not only makes a mean coffee, but also serves some good sangria.   a great cafe to pass the day away.

_pIG1_s6Bzymn1zeyLjBHQ.review_text: Europe - meet San Francisco. San Francisco - meet Paris.  Something about this place just rocks.  I've walked by here on many evenings wishing I had scored outdoor seating to listen to the live band play.  It's always full, it seems.  Finally, on a relaxing Sunday, we strolled into this place and ordered our beers.  We initially got indoor seating and then moved outdoors when a spot opened up.  First - the people next to us showed attitude about us sitting there, as if their invisible friends were already sitting there or something.  Didn't please Mr. Rob at all - and just made him scoot in even closer.  Second, Jon observed then commented that the three people next to us all were wearing the same thick black-rimmed glasses.  Brad Pitt couldn't make those rims cool, but all three sported them nonetheless, apparently thinking it worked for them.  (It didn't.)  They frantically wrote (or drew) in their black notebooks, intermittently smoking a cigarette, without speaking a word while the music blared from the live band and conversations took place everywhere.  It was like a scene out of "A Beautiful Mind" - except it wasn't.  Then....  All of a sudden.....  "SHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!!!!!!!!!!!  SHHHHHHHHHHHHH!!!"  Uh - what? I start looking around wondering what is going on only to be find that "Nerdorama", as a group, was shushing everyone else because the piano was playing.  Dudes - who's stranger?  Us for coming to a bar to converse and drink beer while listening to music in the background? Or y'all, with your notebooks, acting like people who can fit the DSM-IV criteria for some neurological condition?  Enough said. And it's not the establishment's fault that some of their clientele is just bizarre, so four stars it is.  Awesome hangout.  For Jon -  all I can say is, "Black Butt!"

kK996Gx3ZoR7Avd5WILFEg.review_text: The revolution cafe is a good place to sit and stroke your goatee and think about how you're going to smash the hegemony of patriarchial capitalism. Even if you're clean shaven or a patriarchial capitalist yourself they pour a decent cup of coffee (no decaf) and the have beer and live music sometimes. It gets kind of crowded when there's a band in there, but otherwise it's a good place to sit and people-watch.

QYUdOyXau5rfGFdyGF5f0g.review_text: I am more so a fan of experience and i allow it to permeate my opinion of a particular establishment regardless of other factors. If you are looking for a review on their menu or their beverage list, or even their cleanliness you may have to read another review or totally overlook all those things and consider the possibilities of a life changing experience. My husband and i were strolling the streets of the Mission for a date night (we have a lot of those) and were both hypnotized by the fresh sounds of "Go Van Gogh". This review is partially about them. here is a link to a video of one of their older performances: youtube.com/watch?v=9V4-… Their sound is playful but tight. These musicians know exactly what they are doing. so, back to my review about Revolution Cafe. It reminds me of a middle eastern cafe. The decor is basic: small space, random chairs and tables spread out, simple menu, dark, filthy restroom, but always full of open people, wine stained floors, conversation, great music, outstanding memories. We have been returned several times and always leave satisfied. note: i left out one star because they could clean the restroom more often. just saying.

wxJt1-_QXhHaT5_QbdkxLQ.review_text: Somehow I am able to pass myself off as a hipster or a yuppie depending on what crowd I'm with, and obviously I'm doing the hipster thing to be sitting here at Revolution. This is the best caf I have ever found and is absolutely inspiring for doing work in; the versatile drink selection also helps no matter what my mood is.   The live music is absolutely awesome, and I'm in love with the dimly-lit aesthetic. Something tells me you'll be able to find me here a lot: it's certainly less scene as Ritual and has a much more European vibe. This is the kind of place I'd want to meet (and take) a girl to: it's classy yet trendy, smart and slightly pretentious, and above all very much attractive.

irFk4niiXe5iR-C7mgjy_w.review_text: The music was way too loud for conversation when I was here on a Monday evening last week.  The sangria was meh.  The people hanging out and chilling were definitely interesting, lots of great people watching to be had.  But the cafe vibe was ruined for me by the music -- if I can't chill and hang out b/c the bass is shaking the table, I'm leaving.

LAX-mM-cOJ2ownL-waC8ww.review_text: This place has that old style ya can't find much anymore...   The casual chill vibe, the real music, the talented musicians... the characters, the poseurs, the dealers, the makers, the marks.  You name it they're all here.  I love san francisco when I'm sitting in this little spot in the mission, watching the trouble walk by, watching the cops cruise by, watching all the nighttime creatures while the daytime people sleep.    I wanna go there right now, actually!

97BHRNfBqubPqisKmj46Ww.review_text: the first time walkin by this place is like that first time you stumbled upon 15 romolo.  you'll do a double take or glance at whomever your with and both shrug your shoulders to that unspoken 'yea, why not'  big fan of the live jazz.  great vibes and energy at night as a place to come by yourself, with a date, friends or outta town visitors  put that phone away and strike up a convo w/your neighbor, shake it all about or people watch, but keep that phone tucked away.  it's too small and fun in here for that.  if you must, at least be unobstructed and out of the way w/it  coffee, food, drinks and service adequate as its more about the ambiance in here

sBf5IfUPxTowTdUebPZVTQ.review_text: How fun!   Is it a cafe? Is it a bar? Is it a coffee shop? By George I think it's all three and then some!  Served by a super sweet girl, this cash only establishment was hoppin on a Saturday afternoon with live interactive tunnes/muscial performances, and plenty of seating for our group. I got the bowl of hummus and chips since it was sorta an in-between meal, and I was not let down!  What's better than pita chips? Homemade bagel chips! While everyone else got a sandwich, we all know who had their meal ravaged by the rest - obviously the hummus plate.  The Revolution Cafe is a great place to go to socialize, unwind, or catch up with a friend or a book - super chill and friendly, where I'm sure there isn't such a thing as a stranger when you are there.

I0LRTvihE5L_ObatUNAn8g.review_text: On a less-than-stellar day in the Mission, I was able to get my WiFi fix and my happy hour fix in the same exact place. It went a long way to cheering me up. Revolution Cafe offers a laid-back bar/cafe atmosphere, great music, and adorable little tables just large enough to prop your Apple laptop of choice.   The downside? For a cafe as wired as Revolution, there sure are a surprising lack of outlets. Regardless, the wireless signal is reliable, and the tap selection  is respectable, if a bit on the slim side.

Zc70pwCztQdhSa3O7-NtYQ.review_text: I love love love the revolution it is so parisian romantic! Another wine beer coffee shop with a light menu it offers a smoker friendly patio that is perfect for your street gazing or artist/ writer/ philosopher self. The prices are reasonable and for all it's vibrant culture you can't enjoy the mission much more than here.

W7DpceSsRQyZOuVYAWQQDA.review_text: My fave place to drink on weeknights.   I love the mojitos, sangrias and Coconut Chai. (The chai is served in bowls!!!!) The regular beers are good, too.   Revolution's unique drinks and style have won me over like that one scene in Magnolia where the quiz-kid tells off his over-bearing dad at the end.  Or not. Just avoid this place like the plague on weekend.

ppOyxHl1EOCNPA5QAdhXqQ.review_text: This place is so unique! I usually go there Sundays afternoon and they have jazz music and classical. The energy of the people there is great and the outdoor seating is a blast.

APQiaEVDLJKiHHUOMFjtDQ.review_text: Yay! Revolution Cafe music is back!

c65gXSyZlP0kCqttoTpHNw.review_text: Update: 10/07- The staffing has changed and seems to at least be civil now. Given the chill atmosphere at this place, the live music, outdoor seating, etc, I give back 2 of the lost stars. I really do like this place. It's the attitude of the staff I could previously do without.  "I would've rated this place at least 4 stars before.  Not so after the outrageous service (or lack thereof) I received.  I was becoming a regular here, ever since moving just a few blocks away. It's such a cool place in so many ways. It's equally a great place to kick back with an espresso as it is to pass the afternoon with a glass of wine or sangria.  The live music makes it even better.   I should've known it was too good to be true. And after this morning, now I do.    Having a couple of hours to kill this Sunday morning, I set out for the Revolution cafe, thinking I'd start off the day by grabbing a light brunch and coffee.  So, I get to the cafe around 11:00 & it wasn't yet busy. Great, I thought, I can still get a table AND won't have to wait forever to get something to eat. I put in my order, wait 15 minutes or so & out it comes. But, wait, that's not what I ordered. I tell the girl who brings it out & she referred me to the girl at the counter where I had ordered. When I (very politely) explained to her that she had gotten my order wrong, she had the AUDACITY to tell me that "Oh well, she made a mistake" but that it " was now made" and she "wasn't going to waste it". Uh, ok, what does that mean? She then explained that she would not make what I had ordered & that if I didn't want what had been brought to my table, she would just give me my money back!!!!! This is a true story.  SINCE WHEN did baristas in cafes in this city reserve the right to serve you whatever they wanted, regardless of what you ordered, and then expect you to just shut up and eat it!!?? I responded "you mean you won't make my order?" and she just ignored me. I was so in shock at having received such incredibly rude and awful service that I didn't think to do what I should have done: take back the $3 tip that I had put in the jar upon ordering (on a  $13 bill no less!)  So, despite the fact that I love so much about this cafe, I will simply NEVER be back. What a shame. My friends and I used to love this place."

WvaNN1ya32aOEeEI4-UmYA.review_text: I went during the day.  The food is reasonably good, and the place would benefit if they cleaned the muck off the tables once in a while.  Apparently the revolution will not be sanitized.

H3PFTHE-SL1gg2exnNy1jg.review_text: This is cool hang out spot where the beers are pretty reasonable and the bands are super fun! The hubby and I hung out here one Saturday afternoon while a jazz band played. We sipped our beers just inside the open patio. So fun!

2Z0I9POv2N5p1_vOnCN9lw.review_text: Didn't have more than a tea here, but I heard the sangria and mojitos are good. Seems like a standard mix of hippies and engineers frequent this particular establishment. Often you'll get live musik, but when I was there it was still early. Aims to be a bit of an off-kilter Parisian cafe, but ultimately the winds let you know that you're still in the city by the Bay.

U5ihhqG7PI7kyE9Ob2uqog.review_text: Revolution Cafe is everything that's right for me about this city. Great vibe, good people around tiny cafe tables in a perfect autumn evening. And music, music, music pouring out from  those wide-open cafe doors and spilling out onto the sidewalks. This is the kind of place that just FEELS good. A place to say hi to a stranger, make a serendipitous connection and discover how in touch  you are to the whole wide world. Joe and David have done a great job of lining up some incredibly talented and incredibly diverse musicians who bring a really great energy to the place. Check here for the latest line-up myspace.com/revcafe2006 The physical space itself is charming, but  music is Revolution Cafe's soul.

Uju5Rl-AMBKSd82f3T_kUQ.review_text: I can easily spend several hours here on a warm afternoon.  it's relaxing, lots of people-watching, great sandwiches and my favorite drink, the Shandy (lemonade and beer).  Don't expect the service to rock. It's typically on thier own time, and often a line forms.  But it's forgivable for some reason.  Maybe it just fits in with the laid back vibe.  I recommend the BBQ sanwich and the chicken pesto.  Good stuff.

pHe20EAItXf1gZm8iGIweQ.review_text: Outdoor seating is great. Good sandwiches. Love the art. Great place to hang out with a bunch of friends and the bitch. A simple request...please wash your floors more than just once a year and hire a counter person with an IQ higher than his shoe size. Thanks!

Gwnv6NL1mCeXt2xfBIX8GQ.review_text: Small corner wine bar with great music and atmosphere

MWCg_rKWLW3f8x1s0R6htw.review_text: Kally Price was singing, the Chimay was flowing and sweet Jesus, I was home.  Great music, scratch that, the LORD's music, Kally doesn't so much sing into the mic as lend us her soul, one song at a time. In fact, if I don't hear her singing after I die, it means I'm in a fiery hell, so...if you could help a brother out and there is a sweet spot within your heart for fat-back drums, resuscitate me with whatever homemade AED you have laying around.  If I lived in SF I would frequent the Revolution Cafe as much as my wallet would allow, but I don't...so I don't and this makes me sad.  The intimate setting buffers the outside world and the music is loud enough to get lost in yet, quiet enough to converse with your friends.  Highly recommend, I wish there was an equivalent in San Diego.

3Ttx_EwurF4tVRn723SIjw.review_text: I could give this place 2 stars, but I'll be nice.  I take bhangra classes across the street from this cafe, and therefore I pass by here on my way home every Thursday night.  It always seems packed and brimming with energy on Thursday nights, with the live jazz band and all.  So of course I decide to finally go here...on a Saturday afternoon?    So the energy was different but the people were interesting and the Beatles were playing (very loudly) over head.  There was one person working in the cafe.  Just one.  I don't know if someone didn't show up that day or what, but a very bubbly girl with a feather in her hair was running around doing everything.  It took a while to place and receive our orders and our table was never cleared from the patrons before us.    We tried beers, tomato soup, and the hummus and bread.  Tomato soup was not good.  Very cheesy.  As opposed to, you know, tomato-ey?  Hummus was decent...nothing special.  Beer was beer.    So yeah, like I said, this could have been a 2 star rating, but may they deserve an extra star for having "Revolution" in the title of their business?  I did enjoy the crowd and sitting at one of the patio tables on the sidewalk and people watching in the Mission...but that's pretty much it.  Maybe I'll try coming back for some live music.    Maybe not.

G1DM_OyYFb32QylgvQGrGQ.review_text: i can't go here without seeing THE HOTTEST PEOPLE IN THE CITY.  love the live music (yay, it's back!) love the beer selection, love the art, love that i have a fat tire pint glass from there (you must have a glass with a bike on it), and i love that it's right there when i need a break from sign language class across the street.  although i don't think anyone is causing a revolution, and may actually wet themselves if one occurred, this place rocks.

6IIc-SQiB9DXywsuoxFdRw.review_text: this place is too cool for anyone . everytime i have visited it is overflowing and you must stand outside and drink a beer on the sidewalk. with a more relax vibe i bet it would be great

LJ3dPkulhruselIEqw9jvg.review_text: This corner of Bartlett and 22nd St. has had several incarnations since it was brought up from the dead sprouts of a funkafied nursery a few years ago.    Before:  Pseudo neighborhood nursery sparsley filled with plants in white plastic buckets. Brown tipped assortment sold by, Pat.  Not really, but the "is he a he or is she a she proprietor/proprietrix was there for a long time.    After:  Change of ownership several times but has the words, in various order, Toby, Revolution, Cafe and Papa.  The artwork is very good and totally adds to the atmosphere.  The quality of the coffee is poor.  The drinks satisfy a solo sit down on a rainy day with the heaters going on, or a group hug that spills onto the sidewalk--mixing with the local alcoholics and lookers.  Has  a definite Euro feel to it, w/ music decidedly eclectic according to whoever's minding the bar/cafe.  Okay, often Latin.  This is the MiSH anyway.  I had the good fortune of riding my bike by on Thurs. evening w/ live melodic music reining me in.  I will always go back to this spot with potted plants, wiggley chairs,  little tables on the sidewalk and a great place to people watch even though not all of what you're going to see is going to be pretty...it somehow turns out to be beautiful.

CU6B8xPsxveZueDewBECXg.review_text: This place is GREAT.  It is very European and it is an awesome spot to people watch.  Better yet, they often have live music.  Pair that with amazing coffee and good beer, it is a winner.

J52_6MJ_a9v0n2y3qv4zYA.review_text: I'm singing like a choir girl. Wife, kids and tapered grandmother in tow. Put your hair down baby. We're laughing with irreverent oomph. Sun spits down, threatening to disappear under the horizon of the blue building across the road. I stare out at some kitsch Mexican delicatessen with the ubiquitous gruff and stout teller-boys, sneering as they hand you back a quarter in change. Turning my head I give the hat-clad hipster serving drinks a nod, a beard of fine trim and a head that alludes to fine wine and literature. He serves us with ambivalent dispatch, and we ain't got no cocktails 'fore the sun kicks the dirt. The crowd ponders it's way through the day, cool kids coloured with consistency - tight jeans and the glint of an apple trademark staring me in the face.   Three lesbians sit to the front, the light dancing over the curvatures of an ill-conceived gun show; hands coiled around pint glass lagers. My father gave his head a wee tick as though to imply these bitches is whack. Him with the red hair and country Irish hick. This day was like a song I'm still singin'.

wZG2xlICfUkJiY1NdPJH2A.review_text: Ain't no revolution. Dark, mysterious yet inside was lined with the glowing faces peering into their macs. Really? Server girl was definitely having a bad day. She'd ask for your order then walk away and make someone else's. It took 30 minutes to get a sandwich (and was mediocre); meanwhile she was busy lighting candles. Food was left unattended to on the counter that seemed unsanitary. Service station for adding to your hot beverage was unlit and hard to see. Chai latte comes from a jug. Was pretty busy, and felt like the place was definitely understaffed. Live jazz music was on Sunday was fun. People seemed eclectic and friendly. Wouldn't come back here for the food or coffee, but maybe for the music and a beer.

ydQ8SD98-6XJ42-x52H8gg.review_text: Love this place.  Greenwich Village meets the Mission.  This is not a fine dining experience.  I'd recommend sticking to the reasonably priced (and great selection of) beverages.  They don't seem to mind if you bring in a slice of Escape for NY Pizza from next store.

0DnK-KP7MlYOlkT-Ioh9mQ.review_text: Come for the cool atmosphere, not the food. Sure, if you're hungry and looking for something to hit the spot, they have it. The food is totally OK, but it's not the main attraction. Checking in at 3:30 on a Wednesday. Plenty of tables, plenty of free wifi, plenty of good vibes, quiet enough to work.

mXR1ns7Zhe_DpxbeIlr_cg.review_text: I've walked by this place several times, only to turn away at the stares of the local missionites as I scan the menu.   Finally I have found a seat on a not-too-crowded Thursday afternoon. It is happy-hour and for just three dollars I have crisp pint, a cushy seat, free wireless (which explains the present tense), and a lovely view of the street. The whole front face en

dBrSL_PJzwTs0OE_V13CXw.review_text: Unimpressive food, the BLT was just ok...but it really gives you the sensation of a French bistro. Small round crammed tables, giving sapce to ensembles raging their jazzy tones. Two beers and a sandwich was almost 20$...the price is European, that for sure.

shfhrdFn8aGgFP8dyXNyxg.review_text: Really fun place on a warm sunny afternoon. I was there, and there wasn't any live music. The server at the bar was really nice and let me try a few beers, I settled on India Pale Ale - a nice bitterness to cut through a warm day.

daEKn0SlW3j3-8zAXx3xBA.review_text: This is an  amazing place to go for a glass of prosecco outside on a summer night. One of the few evenings you do not have to wear a jacket or sweater at 8 PM . They were playing the Beatles. Great vibe, service is relaxed, it's ok I had time I was playing hookie from work.

ZWZ5cA0Sm24cUlwWRmAJDA.review_text: Loved the vibe here, felt like an open air cafe back in the burroughs. Wonderful beer on tap! Wonderful! Mmm, Chimay! And the little space heaters made it warm and romantic on a slightly chilly winter night. The kind of place you could go to w/ friends or alone..peoplewatch/ write/ spaceout/ crossword. Can't wait to go in the summer.

rrEVfq-CGbHlSqQyq9ACzg.review_text: If like any normal pitiful human being seeking comfort in this cruel world you desire the twin pleasures of drinking coffee and smoking cigarettes AT THE SAME TIME, then this neighborhood can really be a fucking major drag.  Thankfully open-fronted hippie dive Revolution offers addicts the space to double up on their vices without having to stand on the street like a dick. As a bonus you can even switch up and drink beer while smoking cigarettes. Hell, you can probably smoke whatever the hell you please, and drink wild amounts of nipple milk. It's all-round smokey drink fest.  However you will need to overcome that creeping sensation that you are about to be assailed by a dreadlocked student of vague European decent who will talk about Manu Chao for three hours and then show you his paintings of a hash farm in Morocco. Sure, there's plenty of wi-fi-riders and local trendies to balance things out, but, on the whole, it feels like somewhat of a hippie outpost.  Yes, there's definitely something a little crusty about the place. I stay away from it at night as most of live music I've heard walking past has sounded suspiciously like a giant hippie jam band wankfest. Not a big fan of the service either - a bit disinterested? Annoyed? Surly? Inattentive? Can't put my finger on it exactly, but they are generally a little on the lame side.  But who needs service once you've got your hot/cold cup of stimulant and a lungful of Malboro smoke? Exactly.

4L-5NBEU2BNgwZ2IVuipxQ.review_text: Uneven floorboards and worn wooden tables mixed with a flood of fresh daylight pouring through the front windows win major points for an afternoon coffee cafe. South American music and complete lack of interior lighting gives you the feeling that you are not really really in SF anymore. The iced coffee is strong and smooth. Go for it, then get a slice of pesto pizza next door.

To7EBxWC-Yz011V2-tdTvA.review_text: Well, first off, this is a cafe with a Myspace page.  I think that sums up everything you need to know.  But of course I elaborate because it's what Laura's do best.  That and curse.  And eat.  I'm also pretty good at math, not applying myself and inventing fresh dance moves.  I also recently found out that i make really delicious brussels sprouts.  but enough about me, let's talk about ME! Papa Toby's is the kinda place where skinny dudes who look alike hang out with skinny chicks who look alike. they share DEEP THOUGHTS about the 3 books they've read (undoubtedly one eggers, one murakami and probably something by a bad beat writer), watch a french film they don't understand and rub up against each other...ugh, i don't even want to know what happens after that but I'm pretty sure it involves vanilla sex and more DEEP THOUGHTS.  normally i can roll with the hipsters, sometimes i even sleep with them and have long term relationships with them, but FUCKING A, this place makes me want to turn all Firestarter and burn the shit down.  I don't know, I'm having a bitter day, obviously.  I'm petitioning for this ballot initiative for the Humane Society that's basically asking for animals on factory farms to have enough room to sit down, stand up, turn around and stretch their limbs or spread their wings within their enclosures (and do hokey pokey if they so desire).  Seems like common fucking sense, I know, but in reality none of our existing animal laws extend to animals on farms.  ANYWAY, we need 650,000 signatures by February to get it on the ballot and we only have 100,000 so far so WE'S DESPERATE FOR SIGS. So I'm out there every lunch break, after work and on weekends, basically prostituting myself for the animals. Don't think too hard on that last sentence, I don't want you to puke.  Okay so, a SWHB (Skinny White Hipster Bitch) gave me a hard time when I was petitioning out front of Papa Toby's because I interrupted her giving blow job advice (!!!) to a gay dude she obviously wanted to bone.  When asked politely if she would care to sign something so that the ANIMALS CAN TURN IN A CIRCLE, she says all snotty like, "Can't you see I'm busy?!"  So I'm all, "Oh it will only take a second."  And she's all, "Didn't you hear me the first time?  I said, I'M BUSY."  And so I'm all, "YOU ARE A BAD PERSON!!!!*" and run home to cancel my evening plans and drink alone.  And I guess that's why I'm like, the worst at petitioning.  Oh and if anyone wants to go petitioning with me, it's tons of fun so please email me!  I'm totally serious!  Afterwards, I will buy you a drink and listen to your blow job advice and laugh at your jokes and be best fake date ever.  We will RULE THE WORLD TOGETHER. (more info here: humanecalifornia.org) *But what I'd really wish I'd said was this something alone these lines:  "Listen, bitch. I know you don't want to sign this because you don't want this guy to know that chick who is so down she can loudly give BJ advice in a crowded cafe is from Fresno and I'm sorry that your face looks like it belongs to a dude and this fool over here ain't buying what you're selling because he's been checking out my amazing cheek bones this entire time BECAUSE HE'S A MOMO and you want me to go away and stop being the salt in your game because let's face it, he'd rather be staring at THIS but i ain't leaving I SAID I'M NOT GOING TO LEAVE NO NO NO WAY until you sign this g-d petition because baby, I LOVE ANIMALS.  and that includes you, heifer."

F94hX4z3gqcUZHEh1_r8eQ.review_text: I was invited to come along Sunday night to listen to some classical music. I was impressed how many people can fit in a tiny little cafe. The music was fantastic. The more I drank the better was the music. Their sangria was amazing; I am no expert of course. It's a great place to people watch: you can find all kinds of people.  If you are a big fan of comfortable lounges and outstanding customer service I would not recommend this place. It took a while for the bartender to acknowledge the existence of people at the bar.  I love that it is open late and the atmosphere is very relaxed. Go see for yourself. I love it!

r6AKmjDkCo_umRI51lWICQ.review_text: Love everything about this place. It makes me want to move to the Mission. Yes it is small and it gets crowded but not never overwhelming. Everyone is supper friendly and chill and I love the fact that they have live music on Sundays too!

qI3l8JVM8EO4uBuisCkgEw.review_text: Wow, I am kind of still in shock that we were actually able to step foot in this place.  I never thought this day would come.  Every time we get an inkling to go here it's crazy busy.    Maybe it was because this time we got there a little earlier in the night, maybe 8 or 9.    Super cool atmosphere.  Very chill, good for sharing your hearts with friends and people watching.    The one bathroom was nice and big, also pretty clean for how many people were in such a small place.

BbAe1xLMPHlEfG1wke2qJg.review_text: Just went here for the first time.  Had drinks with friends.  They serve beer and wine only (and some kind of rice wine stuff).  The sangria was pretty good, I liked the pomegrante crush drink (served in a pint glass) much better.  The people playing the piano were fun.  The seats aren't very comfortable.  Smallish place.

yvr3BGnQVzACGtMw-ucKiw.review_text: The revolutionary idea about this spot is that it is one of the few places around that you can have a drink and a conversation at the same time.  It's also perfect for those days when you feel like being out and about but still want to put some time in on that latest literary find. Cop a table outside and watch the world go by. Papa Toby's is like your favorite coffee shop with the added bonus of quality beers and wines. (I Still haven't had anything to eat) Live music adds to the ambiance. Simply put this spot is a nice place to be.

an0aBBJ4eCzdT_-f5QBEOg.review_text: This tiny cafe reminds me of Europe. Stumbled on this place by accident after my friend and I left the Make Out Room across the street to have a smoke. The tables on their sidewalk patio has heat lamps--perfect for those cold SF nights. Tried to go back since but it was too crowded. Hope to be back soon.

_lZTr2s5gajJNW2xV1CDMw.review_text: Dear Revolution Cafe,  I've searched all of San Francisco for a wonderful cafe that has all the things that I need in the world....  1-Solid internet that doesn't cut out as frequently as normal cafe free internet 2-Solid soy lattes in big ol' cups. 3-a place I can smoke cigarettes that I dont feel like 'that guy' 4-Solid sandwiches (yes sometimes you don't have all the ingredients, but I love that- ..it gives you character.) 5-Not that busy in the morning- so when I work from home I'm in silence 6-Picks up by 5..so if I'm still working-i have a ton of new friends 7-KICK ASS prices for happy hour.. 8-comfy seating (try for the front seats especially..) 9-pot smoking patrons......I swear, every time I'm here i get second hand stoned off my face....  So in short Revolution, I love you.  I love the people who come and hangout in you, I love the fellow who plays piano inside you when I come early sometimes.  I love your employees who always are sweet and helpful, and I love your patrons who are stoned off their face talking about politics and art.

DlNSN5u0TJ9ZalDoCLdDgQ.review_text: Slightly ennoying hipster/circus croud but the outside sitting is nice. The music, when it's playing is very loud. The staff is unfriendly but not such a big deal.

SOZnTwFFFKeSzIrL8Vl-6Q.review_text: To me Revolution Cafe epitomizes a cool Mission music venue. Sitting back and sipping a pitcher of sangria here, while listening to a show, is just the epitome of cool. Come here and you see not only Mission dwells, but people from all walks of life, chilling, boozing, and drugging out to their heart's content. If you're not that kinda person, you have a wide variety of coffee to choose from as well.  Revolution Cafe's open wall adds to the coolness factor but ironically at the price of increasing the chill in the cooler days and nights. I take a star off for that, but dress warmly and you should be good. Or enjoy this place on San Francisco's "warm" (haha!) summer and fall nights.

YmTS2FFbScIKrGNywXgkag.review_text: Loved much for the live music, the crowd and the outdoor/indoor seating which is bright and lively.  Fine enough coffee and sandwiches, beer/wine/cocktails, salads and cookies.  Slow service but couldn't care less since its just a place to chill and not rush or care about much but getting a few pages further down into Ulysses or whatever other book that might be brought along.  Cigarrette smoke, cappuccino smell, and the smell of the orange the guy across me was peeling are nice somehow together.  Am still in bit of wonderment how the guy behind me was able to pinpoint the exact place i was at in Ulysses just from a word or two.  EXACT place.  That's freakn crazy.

RPLub67SZbxI0_KZYODxvg.review_text: As close as love at first sight can be with a cafe...

US4XWHCxjPA07Q_MESq0cQ.review_text: Maybe they should call this place revElation cafe. I had a few when I came here. One of which is how awesome i felt sipping my beer outside with live but not intrusive music in the background. **bliss**

_XYsWFwZ9JSC_kRJyhc-Mw.review_text: So classy, in that 1940's beatnik sort of way.  I went Sunday night for the first time and got away with a beer and no I.D.!   The line up was a string quartet, some flautists and well trained female piano duo.  It was amazing, grown up and super crowded -- I loved it.  Come join the crowd, I like being close to strangers...

u8kl2I5VzsK0C-6ew8W4ZQ.review_text: Monday January 30th @ 9:30sh.    Last night could have ended better, I'm not impressed with the service.  I left as soon as I could with my company because of the way we were treated by the bartender.  I don't care how many years you've worked there.  We were paying customers, we came to be entertained, not to be the subjects of your horrible work ethic.  Be nice to your customers, they don't need a job - YOU do.

0juzbrgcLHqobdK-OZAyiw.review_text: This is one of the coolest hangout spots in the Mission. With an open patio and kick back environment, this café offers an exciting list of drinks that ranges from wines, cocktails and beers on tap to an array of espressos and lattes. I came here last night but it was super crowded so I had to return earlier today in order to grab a seat by the door. With an antiquated wooden floor, wobbly small tables, wide open doors and windows, and wall to wall of artsy photographs, the vibe is young and vibrant. Next to the bar is a group of five women studying away while those seated on the open patio are chucking on their tall glass of beer and people watching. Noticeably crowding the right side of the room is the five laptop users including myself. The combination of free WiFi and happy hours equals happy times and happy vibes. It's been hours since I've been sitting here but at the end of the day the place is just getting started with a pronounced singles scene and cool music blaring in the background.   This is my second visit this week. A person who was feasting on an impressive looking lox bagel next to me earlier said, "This place is not known for its food but people come here for the vibe." Their espresso drinks are not Philz-like but better than many of the places I've been. Today I tried their barbeque pork sandwich ($6.75) that came pressed hot with a decent portion of bbq pork dressed in a semi sweet and savory sauce and melted cheddar. Portions were good and it came with a side of fresh greens with a light balsamic dressing that was enough to hold me till dinner. Pretty good, nothing revolutionary, but it does get me by.   Unlike other cafes, they also show films every Monday night. I was here last Monday evening and the packed house cheered on for the filmmaker as I sat in the dark little corner going through rounds of NFL fantasy draft. At first I thought the presence of my laptop and bright screen would irk those seated nearby, but no one minded. Overall, I think the mixed atmosphere of a bar and café with weekly special events certainly make this an exciting communal space for singles, bilinguals, and intellectuals alike. A great place to bring out of town guests and groups. The only complaint I have is that once I leave this seat right now, I will never find another one for the rest of the night. Not the most conducive to quiet studying but certainly four stars for a unique concept that will continue to draw a nice crowd.  I will definitely be back and maybe one of these days I will even shut down my laptop to catch a free screening with those that are here.

OMwf9XKXdtd_77Fa2bcPzQ.review_text: People seem to smoke weed quite freely in here. At least when I went. Depending on who you are, this may be a good thing or a bad thing.  Good place to go for drinks and conversation among hipsters. Some strange decor. I think that is a cow/pig's heart on the wall. Gross......

2UcWRvyQDYlVh_4pOfYd5g.review_text: Would give it 5 stars but the popularity of the place makes it hard for me to give it a perfect score, especially because I live two blocks away and feel like it should really be a neighborhood spot.  Live Music, potheads, beers and the most eclectic grouping of people makes this Mission gem one of the only places in the city where you can just relax and come as you are. It tends to be overcrowded at night with hipsters and hippies alike but the cheap drinks and amazing live music makes Rev Cafe well worth the dank aroma.

W7zM3JpvlxJvPfquAdBQGg.review_text: I almost don't want to review this place because I feel like it will lure people to my favorite place. I'll be honest, I have never had the coffee and their drink menu is not great. But, come on people its not what you go to this place for! Think live local artists with culture spewing from their finger tips.. Beautiful talent.. Absolutely amazing and there is NO COVER CHARGE! So if you don't like it you have really enjoyed the real reason to go to this lovely spot.

GrUjyOfjODiCfwM0mCbo1w.review_text: I spent the entire duration of my layoff at this cafe for a few reasons.  Practical: Free WiFi, they don't mind if you plant yourself there for 3 or 4 hours at a time, and inexpensive, decent eats.  Indulgent:  The coffee is just as good as the beer, and it feels a like the cafes I used to hang out in Amsterdam that time I was abroad in Europe.  It's part nostalgia, part feeling cooler than everyone else. :)

b6TEbRu2Njv7yOHXY2konA.review_text: I have always driven by this place and seen LONG lines out the door. Let's face it, $8 for a cup of coffee is a bit exorbitant.  I don't care where it came from and who is filtering or pouring for me. However, the baristas were nice and informative; the cafe, very spacious and internet-friendly; and the walls had interesting art work.  The vibe felt like I was in Brooklyn, NY for some odd reason.  The quality of the coffee was ok.

h1hSm-ASMmwbTPfx69fp0Q.review_text: I like it here most of the time. It gets ridiculously crowded on weekend nights of course so its impossible to get a drink or even get in.   But getting there on a regular weeknight is a different story. there's always a table or two for 3 or 4 and it has that nice dark and calm atmosphere for drinking a beer, cocktail, wine, coffee or a nice big cup of hot cocoa. There's live music every night and even the bartenders go play and sing a few songs. Try to order a beer or a glass of wine when that's happening because they usually give it to you on the  house. Its a place i like to go during the day though, its a lot quieter and more relaxing.

TmAd0zvOqTd7lRCclz_ouQ.review_text: Hipster-y spot with good live music. The space is small, and it gets crowded quickly, but this place can be many things to many people: coffee, beer, wine, etc. I might not spend a whole evening here, but it's a good place to stop in or meet up before heading onward.

fIlg-nPTAUS-q9RjUOe0Zw.review_text: I agree with my cousin Kristy L. This place is totally legit. Tons of tables, great beer on tap. And a seriously good vibe from the customers and the workers. Ask at the front desk for the wifi SSID and code.

E81YUvP761AtM7WRRrkHNg.review_text: The place exemplifies the Mission: Dark, Quaint, no frills with a young/hipsterish clientel. I try to take my B&T friends here, when they visit the city, because I feel that they get to really get a feel of the Young San Francisco pulse.   The Ambiance and energy is what makes this place, it's a great pre/post dinner stop if you are in the area. This is not a final destination point, but rather a great warm up or cool down to a night in the Mission.

cmUmgol1Xsw9U9BmnIMFxQ.review_text: Chill ambiance to enjoy a sunny San Francisco afternoon, sharing a space with all kinds of people from all over the world. Enjoy the live music drinking a good cup of Cafe Au Lai or  zipping a local beer.  It does have happy hour $1 off draft beers, also has free wifi

btgZWY-IciTg4q61saeJ9Q.review_text: Really good live classical music here Monday nights.

GuMkSUhINdQlOvZy0MmSTw.review_text: My friend and I stumbled in here on a weekend night looking for something casual but fun and we were definitely rewarded for our wandering ways.  There was live music and a good crowd out.  The drinks are priced just like any other neighborhood bar so you won't break the bank.  The set up is very much a cafe and in the corner near the bar is where the musicians set up shop.  The acts we saw were really good and according to the other visitors we chatted with, this place often draws good musicians.   Revolution Cafe is gonna be filed away as my casual hip entertainment spot.

F7ETXDhLSJfZhMmo1LF1TQ.review_text: I have been to this cafe a dozen of times and to be honest the only reason is because it's pretty convenient. I came here for the first time a few years ago when I was taking classes at San Francisco community college and since that I have been coming to this coffee a few times per year. I am not a big fan of it because it's filthy, always filthy. I wish the managers could tackle this problem, I know I am not the only one who has this feeling regarding The Revolution Cafe.

j9Wf7fnD8z7gACsFgQGdLA.review_text: Service here leaves something to be desired (read: everything to be desired), but the place is so damn cool.  Warped hardwood floors, flyers everywhere, tasty ass coffee - it's an SF hipster's fever dream.  They have live jazz here every night, featuring jam bands full of people that look like your next door neighbors.  They serve beer and food, though we didn't try either.  It's a 2014 version of Cheers, where the atmosphere is chill and non-judgmental and the people you meet come from all walks of life.    The bathroom, however, is flat out horrifying.  Avoid at all costs.

YBLzdRxQ6WTuR0Y-c8-q1g.review_text: the best place to meet crazy and interesting people. Live music every day and awesome people working there. Special Mention to the great Greta great!

FoBh5FSU4b2of9vD5834EQ.review_text: I love this place. It has such a calm yet progressive atmosphere. I enjoyed a wonderful glass of wine and listened to enchanting live piano music. I will definitely be back!

wGmfD_eB9-BuWHrmf3-bJQ.review_text: NARC comments aside, great space to chill out. Feels like you not in the US for a brief moment.

bvwYD6VmBH5VfdEWDFa_PA.review_text: Papa Toby's is made of magic. Going here kind of makes me feel like I've left the American tedium and suddenly found myself transported somewhere European. Where the chairs are turned towards the sidewalk. Where you can hear two or three languages being spoken around you. Where everything is red and cozy and saturated in colors. Where the cheese is melted into the bread so nicely. Where accordions and bass fiddles are more common than a thoughtlessly plugged in radio.  Maybe I'm a sucker for this place because I AM European. I personally find it a gem of a coffee shop and the entertainment is always pleasant. Sandwiches aren't bad either, although I wish they'd have different teas.

jnmczPEkhRsUFos_nBPjTA.review_text: After an amazing brunch you don't want to end, what's the best thing to do? Find another spot where you can keep the fun going! After looking up 'live music' in the Mission on Yelp, Revolution Cafe seemed to be the best choice! And it was! :-)  Revolution Cafe is a quirky mix of a bar and coffee shop in the middle of the Mission. When we arrived we got a little table with two chairs at the patio and  later found out they were VIP seats. Thats' right! People were eyeing our seats, which made our experience even better!  They had sangria on the menu, but they ran out of it, so we drank mimosas instead. The band was just starting, and it was a nice mix of blue-grass and jazz. The crowd was very eclectic - old lady with dog, international couples, a group having a philosophical discussion about Heidegger,  and quite a few people preparing and lighting up a joint as it's nobody's business. Everybody seemed so free and so present that made me wonder why I don't hang out in the Mission more.  After a couple of mimosas, some people watching and lots of laughs, it was time to come back to a different world. But now I know that Revolution Cafe is there whenever I feel like having a little revolution on my day! :-)

6bfcLLL35DpsxAxxk5ZNAQ.review_text: Oh yeah. If I could spend every afternoon sipping a beer on the sunny outdoor patio with soft live music playing behind me and some of the best people watching theater you could ask for going on in front of me, you know I would! :)

CaD1dbfZ4uB5PAQ61g6fUw.review_text:
I've been by this place a few times over the years and could never figure out what it was called or remember exactly where it's located - probably because it's located down the street or around the corner from most of the great bars in the Mission and I was usually a little tipsy on past visits. Now that I moved back to SF I finally tracked it down.
  Anyway, one of the coolest cafes in SF with large front windows that pull completely back making the cafe spill out onto the sidewalk. Feels more like a cafe in New Orleans, LES New York or Havana than SF - it's got that cool indoor-outdoor, rundown old world feel.
  Any Yelpers know where that beautiful bar comes from - looks like it was salvaged from some grand old saloon?
  Oh, and bonus stars for being open so late - you never feel like you have to rush to or from this place. Bonus stars for the free wireless. And bonus stars for Sunday night, when they (apparently) push all the tables back and give free tango lessons and an "Argentine Tango Social Dance". This one is a classic.

t4pkt6sPeRyj-QhZGSPQYw.review_text: With so many cafes popping up at random spots all over the city these days, the Revolution Cafe is one that stands out from the rest for a few solid reasons...number one, the people-watching is excellent. And this is the kind of place that really encourages it, so you won't feel awkward doing a little staring here and there or being the subject of somebody else's staring.  In fact, you kind of forget that it's happening.  Number two, the atmosphere is very artsy, relaxed, peaceful, but there seems to always be something going on that makes it worth being there.  Number three, it draws a diverse, interesting, and genuinely friendly crowd, which to me is a big deal since I really can't stand cafes that pretend to be all independent anti-corporate establishments, but you know as well as anyone else there that its really just a facade that is used to get people inside (Canvas Cafe R.I.P.).  I can't really comment on the food or drink, but they do have a very extensive menu.  I did try a small cup of tomato soup which was very tasty but it was already room temp. when it was served to me which was a little disappointing since it was such a cold night.  Also, with the front part of the cafe being completely outdoors, you should make sure to dress warmly when going here.   To conclude, I would definitely go back to this place...its a very cool spot to hang out after work with some friends and have a few drinks and fun conversation.

-0yeHuiNDLIhyR7eW8mqVA.review_text: Listen to some hipsters talk micro vortexes and clean energy while smoking weed out of an apple bong, and watching a homeless crack addict slobber all over himself on the sidewalk and harass the customers and until the police show up. Welcome to the Mission.  The place itself is nice, however, plenty of outdoor- and window seating, cool art on every wall, beer on tap, working wifi, and friendly service. Apparently there's music at night, but I didn't stay that long. All in all, this is a great place to come for working, reading, or just hanging out and meeting friends. Would come again.

VCROW1kVZhf1XYzBwQ8B-w.review_text: I can't even describe how much I love "The Rev" as my friends and I call it. If you caught us last Sunday jamming Bach, you'd understand. Aside from that, I love the idea of people standing around, sitting and socializing quietly while there is great music playing - classical, jazz, whatever. And the front porch is sweet - several tables, everyone mingling, and - they serve mighty leaf tea (yum) and you can pick your own wine!

scH5Ju0cczmkPAKXDdyNHg.review_text: Live jazz, good beer, outdoor seating, done.

yHaKyHVTuOZiWPKj7nqiPQ.review_text: Cute place, but the rudeness I experienced from one of the bar girls during performance hour makes me seriously downgrade my rating. I see other people have complained about her, and maybe it's the same girl. She should not be serving drinks to people until she learns very basic bartender customer service.

bG5FOHlm3rH9a6-sjkQjMA.review_text: My roommate discovered this cafe because he knows the blues band that plays there on Saturday nights.  Since our first trip we have been back almost every Saturday.  The little menu offers delicious sandwiches and salads.  The sangria is fabulous and people always seem to have a beer so it must be good too.  They have the best chai, it is made with coconut milk.  The crowd is diverse and we always find interesting people who like to chat.  They have frequent live music and from what I hear salsa dancing on Fridays.  Overall, if you are looking for a fun, unique place to relax and enjoy good music then this is the cafe for you!

lY5tXCnwtGXY9E8yUuqKdQ.review_text: cool hang out, especially on a warm afternoon.

hNRC2qPx9K8kbc1imQ1-rA.review_text: This is an amazing cafe. Love coming here especially when they have belly dancers and performers on a Friday night . I've been here on weekday nights and it never disappoints me. The flour less chocolate cake is to die for especially this coming from a non chocolate fan like me. A shop u cannot miss going to when in San Francisco

YX_5RAyYDpXGFCMIjl0nRg.review_text: DONT EAT THERE..unless you want a cooked SPIDER. Can't believe I'm giving it one star!  a few days ago I would have give 5 stars, this is my place, I loved it!!. NOTE: this one star is ONLY for the food. The rest still amazing, the best bohemian vibe and music!!!..great place to sit and expect anything, from a random person to go in and play the piano, to a big brazilian band on a Friday with NO cover EVER.   Ok, the one star.... I loved their coffee and didn't mind the always messy place...guess thats what makes it relaxed and bohemian, often a bit dirty. OK so been there twice for the Hummus and Pita plate..second time I order the coffee, the cup seemed dirty? wasn't sure but told her and she changed it. Ok...so I go put cream and I noticed a cockroach running ...ok..I tell the girl...I figure well....open place..open place...maybe one got in.  FInally, enjoying my coffee and Hummus when I'm about to put the fork in my mouth and I noticed ....gosh how did I noticed it was a spider! well..I guess the subconscious mind...the image of the way a spider looks when its been crunched and killed. ...but I look closer...maybe is the bread? ...ohhhh........I see the leg stiking out!!!! ohhh..I clean it up from the Hummus...ohhh.....Yes clearly a SPIDER on my plate!!!!!!!!!!!!!!not out....not on the side...inside the food!.......I been having nightmares of eating out again because of this.  I loved this place and I hate to post it on Yelp but I really think their kitchen must be disgusting for this to happen, if you've been there then you know the place is not he cleanest place but I though oh well..the city has a great and strict health program and it must be clean...yes, I need to do more research.  I decided to post this because I really would hate for people to eat there, who knows what else happens in that kitchen.

RfBdlTtXIIGTl-jpzvBH7w.review_text: Came here for Sunday night classical rev.  I understand the music can be a hit-or-miss. Yesterday was definitely a hit. We had world class players playing in an intimate setting. Can't imagine anything better. BTW, the latte was lukewarm but it was a nicely pulled shot. Overall, a unique neighborhood hangout w/ character.

rVNTc_dE8icv-E5oPfLVgg.review_text: Revolution is a great place to hang out on a sunny day in the mission. The staff is friendly, but don't expect fast service.  The only reason I can't give them 5 stars is that there's a huge inconsistency in how stuff (even coffee) is prepared from one employee to another. I've had both a great and an awful Chicken Caesar there, and same goes for getting a Mocha.

LJ8pZyOkNmmXYs-0ES3YXA.review_text: This place had a really great vibe, but the staff wasn't very friendly.  A group of 6 of us walked in at 11:30 or so, and we went straight to the bar to order drinks.  When the waitress put two of the drinks up on the bar, I ordered another two.  At that point she rolled her eyes at me, and went to go get the other two beers.  6 beers and she acted like it was 30.    I love the fact that this place has live music, and you can order beer or coffee.  It's very European and attracts a lot of hipsters, which I most definitely am not.  I love it because it's focused outside, and there are tons of people out on the sidewalk dancing when the music is playing.

T0gWkTHWRChVUe_Dn1F8nw.review_text: Took a stroll over from the Latin American Club since they don't serve coffee anything (they don't have their pool table anymore, either).   The most interesting snippet of people in one enclosed place in a long time. 5-piece string musicians surrounded by scrabble, many apple laptops open to their Yelp review windows, conversations in all kinds of languages and lots of crazy hair and tatts in the mix. The scrabble guys looked a little plain, but that's OK...they were probably D&D kids in elementary school anyhow. It's places like this that make me miss the city. Then I remember circling for parking and the memories dim.  Oh, and my mocha was excessively course and sweet. So minus one star.

e9Q3M4L9DwmtoBuBBux8Hw.review_text: Really enjoyed this place.  Super fun vibe, great neighborhood feel.  I went there to work that day on my laptop and the atmosphere was super friendly.  When it got dark outside, they turned down the lights and turned up a dance beat, which to me was...AWESOME.  They also have live music.  The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 was that when it's really busy there's no seating :(.  We went there last time I visited San Fran and we were super disappointed that there was no place to sit.

4I7aa289QLmeKm-YabKbYg.review_text: Came here around midnight and although this is really a coffee shop....it's was packed as a *bar.  I think I would adore this place for high tea or early evening drinks.  I love the decor.  Service is speedy and low key.  And from the review there's free wifi :D

K-NT_xHy7q779oSPLCyvNQ.review_text: The leaders of the Revolution have obviously garnered great success...  There are always fifty million people at the Revolution Cafe. At all hours of the day. And night. They have OBVIOUSLY become devoted to the cause.  Joining the Revolution obviously makes you uber, UBER hip. Because the hipsterness spills out onto the sidewalk here like... like... like I don't know what. I'm literally at a loss for words. In all of the Mission, in all of San Francisco, I can't think of anything more hipster than this place. This is hipster mecca.  The Revolution has provided much-needed amenities to the community, like an old upright piano that they'll let anyone walk in and play, free wireless, and the Revolution's leaders welcome some pretty nasty Mission street people, even, with smiles on their faces.   But their veggie sandwich is really kinda boring. And their bathroom is NASTY. And their service is SLOOOW. I think this is because the Revolution is lead by...  SHH!  Potheads.  I hope they're not listening...

fMhm0OW0h9n163gbFmstcg.review_text: Great coffee and atmosphere and this place is always packed with locals so you know it's good coffee!

zf_9FrYd-h2A0dyOCPVl9g.review_text: I am really scared that I am going to wake up one day, check out local news and find out that Revolution Cafe will close because of a new ugly condominium.  What can i say, I don't know any place like Revolution Cafe in San Francisco. I don't think I can single out one thing that makes it special but the place itself, the whole vibe I guess, is like no other place I have been so far. Just today, someone sitting next to me shared his Lava Cake which was pretty darn good.   So yeah, if I need to speak the Yelp language "this place is great, they have the best lava cake ever, yay!". For me, it's the feeling of paying a visit to a friend when I go to Revolution Cafe, which makes it a 5*.

CYAtS12sqOUlvkWsaFusfQ.review_text: dear lord i want to like this cafe.  It has great music on the weekends, and a great outdoor patio that really can't  be beat anywhere in the mission for enjoying nice weather and people watching.  BUT HOLY CRAP THE SERVICE SUCKS.  any and every time i've been there i've been kept waiting for an unnaceptable amound of time for what are usually very small orders- drinks usually.   and yet i kept going back becuase of the nice patio and local.  the last time i was there i ordered an arnold palmer (half lemonade, half iced tea) i waited 10 minutes before going back up to the counter.  the waitress, with an air of being bothered, told me she was making more lemonade. I'd like to point out the place was mostly empty and no one else was ordering. I went back to my table and saw said employee walk out from the counter, leave the cafe, and *go next door for a sandwich* without bringing me my drink or making it at all. she came back 15 minutes later and after further prodding took out some lemonade from the fridge (which im sure she didnt make) and begrudgingly make me my simple drink.   thats right. 45 minutes for lemonade.  $%^ this place.

mkQ-J4uMULsJvc9V8gMENw.review_text: This spot is not a great morning coffee spot, but more of an afternoon beer  in the sun - or tea or coffee.  The way it opens onto 22nd connects you with the street and neighborhood more than any other spot around.  Sorta like sitting on your stoop - and everybody loves that.  They do have decent coffee, beer on tap, food, occasionally live music, and free wifi.  Yeah.  3/5 coffee 5/5 atmosphere 3/5 service 4/5 food 3/5 value

U9KQnvh50-Y1nhSGC2bpKw.review_text: I had passed by twice on my way elsewhere, and got lured by the live music. Went there yesterday, to find no live music, alas. Still, very good atmosphere. They have a couple of reds open on the bar. The Malbec tasted better than the Shiraz, which again tasted better than the Pinot Noir. Meanwhile, I totally drowned in her eyes.

9fg9i7ke1NAGhf8W3e97VA.review_text: Awesome place for those who love outdoor cafes. You can have coffee, a pint, salad (my personal fave there), and sandwiches. There is an independent flare at this cafe that you will miss if you are sitting in a starbucks. The tables may wobble, but the posters on the wall and the neighborhood ambiance will keep you coming back.

EzNZP_kK3lZ5qWCP3n54VQ.review_text: Get to the Rev and get cultured.   Or something like that.   I hear it's a fun hang all the time but I'm only there on Sunday nights to witness and participate in the spectacle of shoulder to shoulder people drinking and smoking while classical musicians set up camp and read chamber music.   Fun and different.   And try the sangria!

1xZflgh5eGuKGtg7PlhNRg.review_text: You walk into a time warp.  Close your eyes: the aroma of coffee grounds mixing with the scent of San Francisco's rain, the sounds of beat music drumming, the warmth of the heated lights and laughter from the locals intoxicates you.  Open your eyes: the red hues, colorful murals, the unpretentious menu keeping you there hours longer than planned, and inspired people all around you writing/reading/smoking/sipping pulls you into Revolution's world. I love this place. Live music in the evenings. Great happy hour prices. The smell of toking pipes. And the feeling you're in San Francisco how it was back in the 70s.  Entice yourself. Go!

29VkFYsJYYhfIav5t0rLRA.review_text: I  love when people don't know what to say about a place but say it anyway. I'm referring to the girl who started her review by admitting that and then kept on writing about everything at Revolution Cafe being "weird". the music, the movies, people that go there.  Like we need more people using the highly simplistic word "weird" to describe our favorite spots in this city.   This is the place in the Mission to hang out and listen to great live music 7 days a week, with no cover charge, cheap beer, good wine by the glass and sangria by the pitcher. There's people from different backgrounds and parts of the world hanging out there, which makes this the kind of place where anything goes and anyone is welcome. Maybe "weird" goes, but "normal" goes too, and everything in between including us people that could give a crap for either definition.   The movies mentioned are shown on Monday nights featuring local San Francisco filmmakers, and it's a pretty great initiative. I was caught by surprise when I stopped there for a glass of wine on a Monday evening and I've been going back as often as I can since, as some of the movies can be pretty good - and free to watch. The other days of the week are great for live music, with bands as eclectic as the place is, ranging from blues to folk to jazz to classic to you-name-it. You bet I'll keep on going.

SyF3myFzNHoSTn6y-HqXbQ.review_text: During the day, I love to sit in a comfy seat and soak in the sun during the day. Drip coffee has gotten much better every since Papa Toby's was sold to the new French owner. Coffee is actually drinkable now. I avoid the place at night. Its too much of a scene and its annoying that people take up the whole sidewalk with cigarettes carelessly dangling from their fingers.

30MGqoQBmgZ1e8K2T_jNHg.review_text: this has been my fave low key spot to enjoy the weather and a beer..or 2 or 3 since i moved to this city. i still love it, it's close to my place, i love the vibe and the indoor/outdoor seating. i'm just bummed i can't go there anymore cause so many people have now caught on to this place that it's impossible to find someplace to sit. *whimper*

r-umhsSDHZ3yY8UnCy3yJQ.review_text: oooo....soo cool...  not.  -= so over it. =-

cU1n3tkLPW67R8gcfyQtrA.review_text: Without doubt the very best cappuccino in town. They use Moschetti Coffee moschetti.com and that is the difference. Enjoy a cup and inhale some fine herbal vapors from the street.

ZbLVUD3yNvffvDvcnN2AIQ.review_text: I was a little disappointed in this place. I was expecting better because of the reviews. I got the drip coffee, which was okay but they ran out of half and half. My friend got the chai latte but it tasted diluted. The barista wasn't very friendly but she let us go when we were down 50 cents. I was also surprised that a cafe would be cash only.

4bJtq3yY_aAqm2Ikg-WJYw.review_text: I dig this bar, quite a bit more than I feel I'm allowed to say.  Why is that?  Well, this place serves the need of a good beer before a show at the Makeout Room, or some decent local washboard blues for a few minutes over another one.  I like the warm, sultry, scattered feeling.  Definitely gets too packed on the weekends.  I'm more of a dive-bar kind of guy, with pool tables and jukeboxes.  Still, I dig this place.  It's a little younger than me, not exactly somewhere I would ever hang out for more than a half hour, an hour at the very most, but I dig this bar.

Rpr__sVvJWqXSqzQTQbxMQ.review_text: it's true, the staff are jerks. i asked a simple question once, and the guy gave me waaaay too much 'tude. get over yourself, "revolution" cafe. i want to like you, but your self-important staff is standing in the way.

TZatgTt9RyYGlBa7uZTgBg.review_text: This cafe is cool as hell and has a great vibe, live jazz always playing, kinda dirty/gritty inside.  The service is kind of terrible.  My latte was perhaps the hottest latte I've ever set my lips on, and I write this review with a burnt esophagus, sore throat, and burnt mouth.  It took a great while to order this latte, and they have just one person behind the counter.  They have some sad pastries sitting there, and lots of beer and beverages to choose from. But seriously, the ambiance is great, the people that hang there are very "mission", I'd go back and maybe get a beer instead of a latte. ;)

m4LS4mkSIX9LTaMPst4UBg.review_text: I went to meet up with someone over here, and I thought the place was cool. It seems the people who come here know each other. It is kind of like the bar from the TV show Cheers, "where everybody knows your name." Oh well, they didn't know my name since I was just dropping by, but maybe if I just come here more often, then eventually everyone would know me since it seems that the people who come here are pretty friendly with each other. Or maybe I just happened to go there when everybody was in a good mood. But other than that, it has that classic style that probably writers, like Jack Kerouac, from the past would have loved. Their coffee is as good as Starbucks too.

Jkb3pZeVr5UmMTairduatg.review_text: What's not to love? I see a lot of four stars and... well, I guess this is the type of place you either get, or you don't.  I absolutely LOVE this place. Every single time I've been there I have had the most fabulous time... the environment is just so relaxed and the patrons are usually so interesting. You can start conversations with complete and total strangers... and some of those conversations may turn strangers into friends. This place has that magic touch!  Anyway, the sandwiches are pretty fantastic, and the drinks are, well, drinks!   Oh! And if you are not a fan of smoking, you might want to avoid this place, because even inside you can catch the drift of tobacco, and other smokables...  Revolution Cafe: I love you!

_s0C7tft4kmXkbRPTD1h-g.review_text: Cool spot with a good beer selection and live music. Good for chillin with friends and wasting some time on a nice evening. This place is jam packed with hipsters, so if you've got an issue with that whole crowd of idiots, then this is probably not for you, but if that doesn't bother you, then give it a shot.

JQnXiuIRwHjB-sEXbu_W3g.review_text: This is one cozy cafe that has an European vibe to it! Pop on in for a nice cup of java or a beer and soak in the live music they've got.   If you're looking to concentrate and do your work here it might be a little too loud and tables squished too close together. But other than that, this is a great spot to people watch (you'll see an endless stream of hipsters and crazies walking around).   Sit on one of the seats facing the sidewalk and get some fresh air as it can get pretty stuffy inside, especially when the live band is playing.

CKE7bImVY81KJD8PiiuDPQ.review_text: live music, drinks and outdoor seating. i'm happy. the sangria was tasty, everyone is real friendly and its a good place just to chill out or bring your laptop. the food looked good too, but i was in a liquid dinner type of mood.
